intro: Corycium venosum, commonly known as the veiny corycium, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, hairy stems and compound leaves with finely divided lobes. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typically white or pale green, and bloom in late summer. Corycium venosum is often grown as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and fragrant properties.
